overview_of_class: COURSE DESCRIPTION / Project planning, scheduling, and control using CPM arrow and precedence networks; resource allocation and leveling; earned-value analysis, linear scheduling; PERT; hands-on experience using computer tools. COURSE OBJECTIVES / To provide students with the ability to prepare a comprehensive project schedule, including bar charts, networks, cost profiles, resource profiles, and contingency analysis; to learn about the importance of time in project management, coordination among stakeholders, and appropriate control measurements.
name: Project Scheduling
title: MEAS CIV_ENV 336-0-01 Project Scheduling
enrl_requirement:
Enrollment Requirements: Pre-req: Students must have completed CIV_ENV 330 to register for this course.
Add Consent: Instructor Consent Required

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: COURSE DESCRIPTION / Project planning, scheduling, and control using CPM arrow and precedence networks; resource allocation and leveling; earned-value analysis, linear scheduling; PERT; hands-on experience using computer tools. COURSE OBJECTIVES / To provide students with the ability to prepare a comprehensive project schedule, including bar charts, networks, cost profiles, resource profiles, and contingency analysis; to learn about the importance of time in project management, coordination among stakeholders, and appropriate control measurements.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: CIV_ENV 330 or email instructor (a-hadavi@northwestern.edu) for permission number.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: areas: 1) Identify activities involved in a construction project and their relationships; 2) Develop arrow and precedence network diagrams and perform schedule computation for PDM networks; 3) Identify the resources required in a project and apply techniques for resource allocation and leveling; 4) Perform cost loading and time-cost trade-offs; 5) Explain concepts and techniques for monitoring, evaluating, and controlling project performance (ie. earned value analysis); 6) Explain contractual and legal issues related to scheduling; and 7) Use a scheduling software.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: One 3-hour lectures each week; Computer usage "PRIMAVERA" Scheduling Software

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: BASIS OF GRADE / Homework 20%; Term Project 25%; Quiz 5%; Mid-Term Exam 20%; Final Exam 25%; participation 5%. / Students will prepare a comprehensive schedule for a construction project with about 190(±10) activities. Weekly lab assignments on preparation of bar charts, network schedules, cost- and resource-loaded schedules, and summary schedules.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: "Construction Project Scheduling and Control" Saleh Mubarak ISBN # 978-1-118-84600-1 2015 3rd Wiley

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
descriptions.value: Handouts from various journals.
